content.description:
Sit start with a large left hand sidepull-pinch and a right hand crimp (same start as

Fertilized Drizzle

). From there, make a few balanced moves on edges, traverse left along the shelf, and finish up

Give Me Weight

.

The problem could go straight up, but I just couldn't shake the notion of that top block not being stable.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good throughout.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Giver.

content.description:
Pink's Gambit climbs an overhanging arete on quality stone over a good landing.

Sit start with a left hand on the arete and a right hand sidepull. From there, paste a foot, gain the right foot shelf, slap the right hand up the feature, do the same with the left hand on the arete, reach a right hand pocket, follow with the left along the featured upper arete, and top it out.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is good, with the exception of the tree stump behind the problem.
content.location: It climbs the south side of Giver's southwest arete.

content.description:
Microloft climbs along a solid dihedral over a very good landing.

Stand start with hands matched on the shelf. From there, reach a right hand sidepull-finger stack, then a left hand edge, bump the right hand up to a sidepull, match hands on the block, reach the lip, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work well. The landing is very good despite the rock just right of the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the east section of Giver's north face.

content.description: Climb straight up the featured slab on edges to reach an easy mantle.
content.protection: A pad will do. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the north section of Giver's west face.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand undercling. From there, work up the layback, reach the shelf, and continue straight up using edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. There is a good landing aside from an old tree stump.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Giver.

content.description: Sit start with a large left hand sidepull-pinch and a right hand crimp. From there, traverse right to edges, then head up through dirty jugs to reach a featured mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is uneven due to rock but pads well.
content.location: It climbs the southeast face of Giver.

content.description: Climb straight up the slab using an assortment of holds to reach an easy mantle.
content.protection: A pad will work well. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the center of Giver's west face.

content.description:
Deep Air climbs a near vertical face via static movement on perfect stone over an ideal landing.

Stand start with hands matched on an edge rail. From there, work straight up through a thin edge to  reach a diagonal sloping arete, then a left hand edge. Follow with the right again to a sloping diagonal arete, bump the left up to a sidepull, reach the lip, and mantle on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the west section of Giver's north face.
